meanings.definition: The quality or state of being driven or motivated.
meanings.sent1: Her drivennesses to succeed in school led her to study diligently every day.
meanings.sent2: His drivennesses to help others made him a valuable volunteer at the community center.
meanings.sent3: The team's drivennesses to win the championship was evident in their intense practice sessions.
meanings.sent4: The drivennesses of the marathon runners pushed them to cross the finish line despite exhaustion.
meanings.sent5: The drivennesses of the young entrepreneur inspired others to pursue their dreams with passion.

meanings.definition: The act of being compelled or forced to do something.
meanings.sent1: The drivennesses of the storm left the town with no choice but to evacuate.
meanings.sent2: His drivennesses to attend the meeting on time made him rush through traffic.
meanings.sent3: The cat's drivennesses to catch the mouse resulted in a comical chase around the house.
meanings.sent4: The drivennesses of the deadline forced everyone to work late into the night.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's drivennesses to maintain discipline in the classroom kept the students focused.

meanings.definition: The determination or ambition to achieve a goal.
meanings.sent1: Her drivennesses to become a doctor motivated her to excel in her studies.
meanings.sent2: The team's drivennesses to win the championship fueled their intense training sessions.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's drivennesses to find nuts for the winter stored up a huge collection in the tree.
meanings.sent4: The drivennesses of the artist to create a masterpiece was evident in every brushstroke.
meanings.sent5: His drivennesses to climb the mountain pushed him to overcome every obstacle in his way.
